model

Class MazeClientHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • model.MazeClientHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer, ClientHandler

    public class MazeClientHandler
extends java.util.Observable
implements ClientHandler, java.util.Observer
    This class implements ClientHandler as a TCP/IP client handler but - BONUS- also implements Observer and extending Observable for REMOTE CONTROL COMMUNICATION! the remote control could tell the handler to stop handle a client (when disconnecting) but the remote control also want to know statuses of clients and what the handler - and the server are doing at the moment.
    Author:
    Tomer

      • handleClient

        public void handleClient(java.net.Socket client)
        The handleClient Method! it notifies what it's doing to the client throughout it's operation. it gets the command from the client, additional arguments and parameters. does as requested and sends.
        Specified by:
        handleClient in interface ClientHandler

      • getMessages

        public java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentLinkedQueue<java.lang.String> getMessages()

      • generateMaze

        public model.SerializableMaze generateMaze(java.lang.String generator,
                                           java.lang.String name,
                                           int rows,
                                           int cols,
                                           int rowSource,
                                           int colSource,
                                           int rowGoal,
                                           int colGoal)
        This method generates a maze! of course, it checks if the maze name was not asked before - don't try to fool it. generating algorithm will be based on the one given at Ct'r by Property.
        Parameters:
        name - - the Maze name given.
        rows - - number of rows in generated maze
        - - cols - number of cols in generated maze
        - - rowSource - Source row of generated maze
        - - colSource - Source col of generated maze
        - - rowGoal - Goal row of generated maze
        - - colGoal - Goal col of generated maze
        Returns:
        - a SerializableMaze to send to client

      • solveMaze

        public model.SerializableSolution solveMaze(java.lang.String solver,
                                            java.lang.String move,
                                            double moveCost,
                                            double moveDiagonalCost,
                                            java.lang.String mazeName)
        solves a generated maze. upon solving - saves in cache.
        Parameters:
        - - mazeName - maze name to solve.
        Returns:
        - a SerializableSolution to send to the client.

      • calculateHint

        public model.SerializableState calculateHint(java.lang.String solver,
                                             java.lang.String move,
                                             double moveCost,
                                             double moveDiagonalCost,
                                             java.lang.String mazeName,
                                             int row,
                                             int col)
        calculates a hint based on an existing solution. if a solution does not exist - it first solves the maze and only then calculating the hint.
        Parameters:
        solver - - how the maze was solved - which algorithm
        move - - which movement was allowed - Diagonal or nonDiagonal?
        moveCost - - movement cost
        moveDiagonalCost - - diagonal movement cost
        mazeName - - name of maze
        row - - from which row to calculate the hint
        col - - from which col to calculate the hint
        Returns:
        a SerializableState - which is the hint - that will be sent to the client.

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable o,
                   java.lang.Object arg)
        upon a disconnection request client will be sent a nice message and the server will await for his ack. then it will disconnect it.
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer
